title: a or an before H?
value: Use “an” before a silent H as with an heir, an hour, an honest politician, an honorary consul. Use “a” before an aspirated H as with a hero, a hotel, a historian.

title: Etcetera
value: Write as etc without without It should be written as “etc..” when at the end of a sentence.

title: e.g. and i.e.
value: Use this form and always follow with a comma.

title: Oxford comma
value: Generally, we don’t like oxford commas unless essential for clarity.

title: Quoting Speech
value: All speech should be in double quotes.

title: Quotes and full stops
value: Full stop inside and outside when quote at the end of the sentence and a full quote.

title: A word in another language
value: Use italics if not commonly used.

title: Dash
value: Use an EM dash whether for parentheses or to separate groups of words. Don’t use a hyphen.

title: Ellipsis
value: If someone trails off while speaking use “...”

title: Round brackets
value: Used as parentheses only when the sentence doesn’t make grammatical sense without.
